intro: Leucanthemum corsicum var. fenzlii, commonly known as the Corsican daisy, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy white to pale yellow flowers with a central brown or dark yellow disc, surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often gray-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom from late spring to early autumn.
